reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Kastelli in May with Olympic Holidays, Had a very relaxing time, the island is beautiful must go to Oia and Fira, we hired a car from the car hire along from the hotel 140 euros for 5 days with 0 excess, which we thought wasnt bad when you compare the prices for the trips ie. sunset cruise 45 euros each!
reviews.title: lovely hotel - beautiful island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is lovely all set out in the santorini style, very pretty, quiet pool at front and and larger pool at the back, also a small pool at the side.
reviews.title: No need for DIY when you have the Kastelli

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend the hotel, nice and central and good accomodation. My only gripe as is the case in so many hotels the bed was hard! (never ceases to amaze, as the bed is surely a big part of staying in a hotel, never sure why hotels skimp on buying decent ones)!
reviews.title: Very disappointing for a member of Small Luxury Hotels of the World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually like to arrange our own holidays, booking flights and accommodation ourselves is great fun and usually saves us a small fortune. With the Kastelli this is different. The hotel price through tour operators is much more competitive that booking direct – which seems odd – but then it does give more of us the opportunity to experience this excellent hotel. It’s interesting to read such mixed reviews on TripAdvisor when this is one of the very few hotels that we have been back to and have had such a great experience on both occasions. The rooms are quirky and cool, the staff friendly and the location excellent. You are just a short stroll from Kamari’s lively strip and the beach and yet you feel a million miles away when lounging by the lovely pool. The buffet breakfast is one of the best I have enjoyed and the setting by the pool is beautiful. We always eat out in the evenings so I cannot comment on the evening food but there are plenty of taverna’s, bars and restaurants along the strip. Kamari is the best town on the Island for nightlife and whilst Fira and Oia are well worth a daytime visit I wouldn’t trouble them in the evenings when you have Kamari’s strip on your doorstep. Be prepared for the bar prices – there appears to be a pricing cartel and it will cost you five quid for a pint anywhere in Kamari and seven quid or more in Fira. Finally, make sure that you pay the legendary Irene a visit at the very end of the beach. Irene Bar is fabulous for lunch and the filleted sardines are the best on the planet.
reviews.title: Kastelli Not So Quiet Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is based on the fact that this hotel is a member of Small Luxury Hotels of the World. The reception staff were terrible here, I find any positive reviews about them very hard to believe. Our first experience of this was as soon as we arrived, we certainly didn’t appreciate being told to hurry when being shown to our room (the woman was practically running). We were shown to a hideous twin room (we booked a double) which was 2 star at very best. The bathroom was shocking - very shabby - a flush which didn't fit the loo, a wonky broken loo seat, mildew shower curtain and a tiny bath. Grey towels supposed to be white I think. Bad red and pink décor (bad paint job too) and finger marks all over the place. If Small Luxury Hotels of the World saw this room, I hope they would be wondering if they should put their name to it. We saw other couples changing rooms throughout our stay, so I can’t understand why they would risk putting anyone in these rooms because the result will only be bad reviews on this site.
reviews.title: A beautiful oasis in a wonderful location with fab staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and Gill stayed at this resort from Sept 8th -15th. The room allocated to us (512) was typical of such resorts and did very little for us... looking out onto the obligatory Greek 'waste ground' and overlooked by a similar block of apartments. We are of course aware that not every room can have a gorgeous sea view or indeed a pool view.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our 'welcome meeting' the following morning i asked the Thomas Cook rep if we could have a more user friendly room as we were not too happy with it. She said that she would speak to the manager. After a few days i asked the extremely nice manager, Nitsa Georgiadou if our rep had mentioned this request.... the answer as expected was no !!... Nitsa immediately arranged for us to have another room and said that we should have asked her as soon as we decided our room was not what we expected.... this lady was very very nice and helpful and the room allocated (317 ?) was perfect, with a colourful pool view etc... just right !!.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Crappy Rooms - Only the Deluxe Suites are worth staying here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, when we arrived at Santorini airport we soon discovered that one of our suitcases was missing. The rep was informed and she did'nt seem unduly concerned. The relevant forms were filled in and we thought that the case would never be seen by us again. Gill mentioned this loss to the hotel receptionist the following day and she said 'leave it with me'. On Thursday the case was found, having been 'stuck on chute' at either Gatwick or Santorini. As i said.. our rep did not appear too bothered about our case but MARIA on reception was genuinly concerned and we think her intervention and local knowledge sorted the problem out.
reviews.title: great accomodation, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THANK YOU MARIA XXX. If anyone visiting Kastelli wishes to meet what is most definatly the most pleasant, kind, friendly and sincere lady you could deal with then she is your person. Having had many conversations with her we soon discovered that she is a Kiwi (well 'part' !!) and having visited New Zealand twice we are positive that Kiwis are the nicest possible people you could meet.... Kastelli's gain is Christchurch's loss Maria !!.
reviews.title: The perfect honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have all met 'bland' and uncaring hotel staff but you will not find them here (especially at reception !!!)... a genuine smile and thought for your welfare makes all the difference.... TOP BROWNIE POINTS MARIA .... all the best for you in the future XXXX.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we went to this resort for our honeymoon and can say that we were not dissapointed. It exceeded all expectations we had. We had upgraded to a suite and had a semi private dip pool which was fantastic. The staff at the hotel have to be their best asset. The service and friendliness was top class and we never wanted for anything. The location of the resort is perfect, 5minutes and you are at the beech with all the main resturants and bars. A bit dearer than most hotels but well worth the extra money. We will be going back!
reviews.title: A brilliant place for a honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks in June 2009. We opted for the Junior Suite and we were not disapponted. The staff we very helful and friendly. The hotel is spread out over large grounds and is no more that three storeys in part. Very quiet and relaxing. All rooms are beautifully appointed. The cleaner came every day.
reviews.title: Like a second honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The facilties were excellent. Three pool areas and comfortable sun loungers with canopies. The buffet breakfast was on from 8 - 12 every morning. Great choice of food. Only ate there twice for lunch, but it was nice, although a bit pricier than the strip.
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is only a 3 min walk from the beach and main strip. Kamari is a very pretty and relaxing place to stay. Lios of great deals, food is really amazing.
reviews.title: Can not wait to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yuo will get a great weclome. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Fantastic, couldn't have done more for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really, really bad - I can't express how truly awful this place was. Staff were sullen and sulky and not all helpful, food was terrible, service was non -existent, room was terrible, we asked to be shown other rooms and they were even worse so we had to stay in our original room, the room and battered bathroom stank of sewage and had a colony of ants that had moved in and where not leaving, at least they didn’t have to pay - everything that you wanted to do was extra, gym - extra, hot tub - extra - I surprised they didn't charge for the sunshine.
reviews.title: Awful - avoid at all costs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For some odd reason the swimming pool water was freezing - ice cold, numbing, head ache inducing cold and the grass around the pool was at least a foot high.
reviews.title: Be choosy about the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a 5 star hotel DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL because it is million miles away from 5 stars
reviews.title: Great location and facilities - stay well away from the restaurant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.title: Like a Holiday Inn -- not on beach, but next to homes with chickens.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in Aug 09. The original room was like a dungeon and had no privacy at all-avoid room 102. The new room which was a superior room was better but Greece's 5 star hotels are not really 5 star. We had a cat and 5 gorgeous kittens for company all week outside but I would not go back to santorini until they sort out their animal welfare, who wants to stay in a place where they routinely poison the numerous strays at the end of the season rather than doing something to prevent the strays increasing. The hotel is lovely and the breakfast from 8-12 is fab. The staff are lovely although the manger did not want to move us and gave away our new room until I demanded she at least show me the new room. I would recommend this hotel but only if you do your homework and can pay for the better rooms. There were quite a few other guests who were also very upset at the room they got. kamari itself has 95 restaurants and is lovely. The beach is pebbles but you don't need a beach with all the pools at the hotel and don't do half board or you'll miss the great choice of restaurants. Would recommend seeing Thira and Ioa and excursions are reasonably priced. if you are an animal lover, don't bother or like me, you'll be feeling guilty all week and since returning.
reviews.title: wedding in Santorini
